messages.title: Save our Service!
messages.content: Karen Robson highlights 'wrong priorities' which see NHS cut Alzheimer’s Care Funding in Cardiff.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposed to the cuts in Alzheimer's care funding by the current government, emphasizing the importance of the service to over 100 families who receive support through it.

mentions.candidate: Karen Robson is Welsh Conservative Candidate in the General Election for Cardiff Central.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Mark Drakeford and Mark Harper have been mentioned in relation to local visits and issues.

issues.environment: Mentioned involvement with Shadow Minister for Disabled people with respect to local organizations and the Road Safety Centre in Maindy was included on a separate tour with Shadow Transport Minister Theresa Villiers MP, further demonstrating the wide range of services offered to Cardiff residents.
issues.governance: Criticizes the Labour-Led Assembly Government for implementing cuts in Alzheimer's care funding and reducing the number of Local Health Boards without achieving higher management positions or cost savings.
issues.health: Highlights the issue of NHS cuts to Alzheimer’s Care Funding in Cardiff and the need to protect this vital service.

housing.content: Mentions Cardiff's roads are crumbling and potholes in part of the constituency. Potholes are a clear indication of the weary road surfaces and lack of proper care.

quotes.text: She has worked with disabled people and voluntary organizations. Karen has worked in the education sector for many years and has a keen interest in defence issues and the challenges facing our Armed Forces and background and when they return home.

images.caption: Image of Karen Robson with a senior gentleman, likely at an event or meeting.
Karen Robson's visit to Alzheimer’s Society accompanied by Mark Harper MP, highlighting the service provided to residents.
Karen Robson at the Road Safety Centre in Maindy, included on a separate tour with Shadow Transport Minister Theresa Villiers MP

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet has a section for showing support for Alzheimer's care services and contact details for Karen Robson's campaign.
